author: petergrossmann
title: Cardano features for everyone
description: トークンの鋳造、燃焼、追跡、トークンレジストリへの登録などの作業は、技術者でないユーザーにはアクセスできないことがよくあります。

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano features for everyone is a great proposal. Practical, laser-focused and user-oriented. I like the name - as it reflects what seems to be at the heart of the https://cardano-tools.io project. Namely, bringing NFTs and minting, burning, tracking tokens or registering tokens to the masses. The size of the project is also very well scoped - and the budget corresponds to the ambition. The proposer clearly has an understanding of the problem and what he intends to deliver. The website is already functional and the project consists of a sequenced expansion of its functionalities - allowing even the non-technical user to play around with NFTs and their traits. Great! I want to try too!
f6_assessments.q1: I love proposals that are concise, yet informative. It's a fine art writing a measured proposal, yet conveying everything. The plan and budget set aside are great. I like that specific sums have been correlated to functionalities that will be built into the https://cardano-tools.io project. The proposer cleary has the relevant experience as a Fullstack developer for 10 years, as the creator of cardano-tools.io and a Plutus pioneer. Most of the functionalities that he intends to add ... such as Burning tokens...  Search for token fingerprint ... Display current owner of tokens seem so logical and necessary (among others)... Each component has an associated cost. That's it. I'm certain this project has all the preconditions for success (unless the proposer sees some risk that he has not listed). Can't wait to see it in action. One tip: it wouldn't hurt to put some "lipstick and rouge" on the website. Maybe doll it up a bit - so it doesn't look too tech-nerdy... as we want non-technical users to use it too (this is just an idea for a possible Fund 8 proposal).
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing seems to be a relative breeze thanks to the clarity that the proposer has provided. He proposes a list of new functionalities and each ones is specified. The proposal includes a certain three-monthly timeline (3, 6...)  and the six-month goal is to  create a detailed proposal and proof-of-concept for a smart-contract for NFTs with forced royalities - 5000$. Amazing stuff. The proposer states: " Making as many featurees as possible accessible for users will increase the adoption of cardano." He is right.

f6_assessments.q0: With the number of NFT markets booming in Cardano, many people are trying to create the same infrastructure again and again. This project will provide a platform that prevents repeated backend work, thereby reducing the effort required for a new startup in Cardano NFTs.  Therefore it can be said that this project is effectively addressing the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has already open-sourced a website template for the NFT site. The current proposal is for adding 10 more features. Assessing the capability of the proposer based on his past work he will be able to implement the proposal in the required manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The work required to be carried out has been quantified and the amount of money required is also quantified.  The amount requested is reasonable and the community will get a working template and site for org NFTs. This will prevent major backend work repetition and the Cardano NFT projects will have a readymade site.

f6_assessments.q0: Theoretically, this proposal dialogues well with the main objective of the challenge, as it seeks to improve an already existing webapplication, whose main function would be to facilitate the handling of tokens for people who do not have specific technical knowledge. However, the author barely explores the relationship between the Cardano blockchain and his website, naturally we are led to think that the products managed here would be part of our blockchain, but it would be important for the author to clarify that this is the objective here and how it would happen. It will reveal "make the conquered resources", but it would be interesting to specify what the resources are, if it would be the handling of tokens, as mentioned before, and how this facility would be provided. Despite being consistent with what is asked in the challenge, I found a proposal in general confusing, it is not explained in a clear and detailed way how this application works. For example, in the excerpt "The cardano-tools.io webapplication covers multiple workflows", which workflows? I went to the site and tried to understand what's going on there, but it's not a very expository site, not if it's not finished yet or if it's like that. I suggest that website owners rethink the user experience a little, that is, how whoever arrived there for the first time can understand what happens and how to make it happen. In short, a proposal makes sense with the challenge, but there was a lack of detail both to understand what will be done and to understand what already exists. So I can't be so sure the impact would be high.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the author's ability to execute the project, we know a few things about him, except that he is the creator of the attached site, he is a long-time developer and also a pluto pioneer. However, it would be positive if the author explained better who he is, from examples of previous works (for example, what he developed over the 10 years mentioned here). We could also get a more solid sense of this if we were given his Linkedin page, if he has one. Another thing that worries me is that he doesn't mention the intention of forming a team, this project is very complex in my view, because it seeks to intensify and diversify the activities present in an existing site, which would require the work of different professionals from some areas. In addition to programmers, I think it would be beneficial for the team to have a designer and someone from marketing, respectively, to make the site more ergonomic and positive, and promote the product to the community. Regarding the requested financial amount, we are listed for which part of the project each amount would be allocated, which is very positive and essential, but I would like each of these parts to be explored further. For example: Handle multiple policies; what kind of policies are these? It would be important to clarify, so that it would be possible to understand each part of the project more solidly. Despite that, it's good how well it divides the money next to each activity that would be developed. And lastly, when it comes to time, he divides activities into 3, 6, and 12 months, with most being done in the first quarter. I was a little confused by the split. If most things would develop by month 3, what happens in months 4 and 5? Is it really plausible to concentrate almost everything until month 3, and then the work is completely focused on a single activity? This may be justified in case this later activity is more complex, but as someone who doesn't work with this, I felt the lack of an accessible explanation to justify such a division.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately there is no information regarding auditability in a specific way. What can be done is to monitor if the tasks listed are being done in the defined period. With this, the community could have some communication channel with the author/team, in order to monitor the progress of activities, this could be done from a team specialized in token handling and with the technical knowledge necessary to understand the general functioning of website activities. Also, the author does not reveal how the project results would be presented to the community, that is, how the benefits would be measured, how could we be sure that the money invested was well used? What could serve as a communication channel would be the telegram, in which the author is willing to listen to criticisms and suggestions, which is extremely positive. This initiative could (and should) be taken further in the construction of the project, in a more formal way, say, through meetings or the delivery of results in stages to be analyzed.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem in the proposal is within this challenge. But the team only provides some key metrics without plan, and there is also no info to show that their idea impact on Cardano ecosystem. For this idea, from my point of view, my advice about key metrics they can choose is about the number of assets, users, or transactions, total ADA value in the market... that all will value the Cardano ecosystem and align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is just a line "Planned features with the fund and KPI" and no implementation plan and detailed explanations about what they want to do. They attach the website but with poor content and design, look untrust for acting. 
My guide is that for assessing the feasibility of the proposal, the team should have a roadmap with a realistic timeline that they can adapt with their team. The budget should fit with the plan and be reasonable, not just listing as they did in the proposal. There is no info and timeline to show that they will do it how and when. 
Moreover, showing some relevant risks with the detailed implementation plan will be appreciated from CA, vCA because it helps to assess the feasibility better.
f6_assessments.q2:
For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic with the ability of team members. This proposal doesn't have these things, that's the reason why this proposal cannot be audited. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem and a solution that to show how they are well-knowing and addressing the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal towards building a tool for minting, burning, tracking tokens or registering tokens in the token-registry. It's a good idea to help the community easily participate in creating applications on the cardano platform without too much technical expertise, helping the ideas on cardano apply deeper and wider to life.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent has a certain amount of experience, but I'm hoping to see a working group with a clearer identity. A proposal with a reasonable amount of money, a simple but necessary idea, to help support the community who do not need to be too technical. I appreciate the feasibility of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The tool is worth developing, and possibly having first tests, which is extremely encouraging. You should publish the project's github page or official website, and have more detailed KPI criteria for the community to easily track and check the progress and quality of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great that can helpful for non-technical users and the problem is within the challenge. But the proposer doesn't have any content to show that this project will help the ecosystem, although there is no info about the implementation for a complex project like this. Moreover, they don't have key metrics. I think that the proposer doesn't have much concern to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer give nothing but required budget, this is nonsense! For proposing a good proposal and enough materials for assessing the feasibility they must give info about a detailed plan they will do, roadmap that with a clear timeline of activities will get, clarify team member info, the budget that is reasonable with the plan and roadmap, risk-relevant that team will face off.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provide nothing in this proposal to audit it. 
No plan, no roadmap, no key metrics in this proposal.
There is also no info about the problem explanation and no info to say how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal gives a tool for non-technical users in the token registry which will help to increase Cardano adoption. My concern is that only a few tools like this are currently in use which makes this project unoriginal and unexceptional. In order to achieve the effects, I would like to see more amazing ideas from proposer to make this project unique.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a qualified experience with Cardano knowledge, which will greatly assist him in executing the proposal. However, there are few programs similar to this utility which will make this tool uncompetitive. Also, the proposer do not give any information about the developer team which means the tool is being built by a single person. So, it might become obsolete if a better tool like this becomes available before it and has been developed by a better team.
f6_assessments.q2: This tool is still in developing process, so it is currently possible to test a few features. The proposal gives a detailed roadmap which will greatly help in auditing process. Github or his telegram is a credible sourse to verify, my recommendation is that a feedback box should be added in this website for users' audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about solving the problem of the open-source webapplication. The problem statement makes sense. The proposed solution is meaningful and briefly described, shows proof of addressing this challenge and the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Therefore, based on the given information, I can agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer profile is very briefly provided, but it is understandable, shows suitable skill, and experiences for implementation, with an external link [https://github.com/wutzebaer/cardano-tools]for verifying. However, it would be better to understand if budget explanations for each item and risk management are added. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided quite a lot of information. However, for better understanding, budget explanations for each item [ex: Why "Create detailed proposal and proof-of-concept for a smart-contract for NFTs with forced royalties" cost 5000$ ? ,...] and risk management should be added. Based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: Although a large number of the features planned to be developed by this project already exist in various other projects on Cardano I would argue that diversity of choice and approach is a net positive for a decentralised ecosystem. Some of the features though I have not seen so far at all, like the ability to easily add a token to the official Cardano foundation token registry, and that is a net positive for the whole Cardano environment. What I would suggest is focusing a bit more on the UI/UX as that would attract even more members of the community to the services offered by this project, thus increasing its impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Considering that a large part of the project that is the scope of this proposal is already built, I see a very minimal risk that the additional features enabled by funding from the treasury would not be completed. I would have liked to see a bit more info about the implementers and their backgrounds, but since the project is already underway that is very good proof of their credentials and capabilities. Besides that for the project to be successful, I would have liked to see a bit of attention paid to marketing. Building great projects enabled by treasury funds is a great thing but that won't bring a lot of return on intention if very few people use them, because very few people know about them.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget given is clear and detailed, the task presented in the KPIs are easy to follow and understand, there is a clear roadmap laid out for the project thus auditing the progress of the project and the allocation of the funds should be a pretty straightforward task.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal intends to create tools to make it convenient for non-technical users to operate, engage and interact in the Cardano ecosystem. It is well-positioned to solve the question "What needs do users of Cardano have that could be solved by new applications?". It is a relatively low investment ($15k) for a high impact on a large population (nontechnical users), very important to make blockchain and Cardano a mainstream technology. Being a non-technical user myself, I wish to have slightly easier to understand description on the problem statement and the features (for example what "Create Metadata for CIP-27" mean to end-users of the ecosystem?).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal's objective is clear (building features on cardano-tools.io) and the proposer presents detailed timeframe (6 months) and results to achieve (broken down to specific workflows to build). The proposer has highly relevant experience (fullstack developer with 10 years of experience, Plutus pioneer, active participant in Project Catalyst, Github link attached) and has built a couple of first features on cardano-tools.io. The proposer also has set up a Telegram group for users to suggest new features and report bugs which will help to scale up this initiative. The budget is proposed for each feature and the timeline of 6 months is realistic. I would suggest adding the metrics of man-hour needed to build each feature, and the cost per man-hour to help the voters compare the efficiency to other similar proposals if any.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear understanding of the problem and proposed a clear, specific solution. It only has one phase of 6 months to complete the list of 11 suggested features. I would propose to add a checkpoint after 3 months for the purpose of a quarterly audit. Moreover, the success of the project is not well defined. Beside completion of the suggested features, should we take into account the quality of products, number of users who sign up to use, traffic on the web application etc,. to better evaluate the return of investment and return of intention? It is recommended for the proposer to add some metrics and criteria to strengthen the project's auditability.

solution: この問題を解決するために、オープンソースのウェブアプリケーション「https://cardano-tools.io」が設立され、機能を利用できるようになりました。
experience:

cardano-tools.ioのクリエーター
